issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
One of the NC this morning (10:20AM) got a libvirt failure? while a new instance arrived there for booting i-EA4C3EE9 , and then after the libvirt on this NC start sending out messages , snippet of nc.log is shown below

{code}
[Thu Sep 27 10:21:18 2012][056106][EUCAERROR ] waitpid() timed out: pid=33910
[Thu Sep 27 10:21:18 2012][056106][EUCAERROR ] [i-EA4C3EE9] timed out waiting for forked process pid=33910
[Thu Sep 27 10:21:19 2012][033962][EUCAERROR ] libvirt: operation failed: domain 'i-EA4C3EE9' already exists with uuid 35e8c93d-0dda-ac89-63ca-b9f913dbb94c (code=9)
[Thu Sep 27 10:21:19 2012][056106][EUCAERROR ] [i-EA4C3EE9] hypervisor failed to create the instance

[Thu Sep 27 10:21:20 2012][056106][EUCAERROR ] [i-EA4C3EE9] hypervisor failed to create the instance
[Thu Sep 27 10:21:21 2012][034066][EUCAERROR ] libvirt: no call waiting for reply with serial 4203357 (code=39)

The instance's are shown as running on the NC (virsh list) but are not visible on the CLC (terminated it shows) and the CC has forgetten the instances.

We need to bring the instances back into the system

{code}
root@node-62:~# virsh list
 Id Name                 State
----------------------------------
  3 i-A6B4424A           running
  4 i-84293D11           running
  5 i-5EE344CB           running
  6 i-8E933EA0           running
  8 i-E1D54556           running
 10 i-3BC83DCE           running
 13 i-AF6F4097           running
 21 i-AB9C42D8           running
 24 i-EA4C3EE9           running
{code}
fields.summary: NC got a libvirt failure causing CC to loose all the instances running

comments.body: Note that a symptom seen on the KVM host was that it was swapping, badly.
